executable.title: Label Map Smoothing
executable.description: This filter smoothes a binary label map. With a label map as input, this filter runs an anti-alising algorithm followed by a Gaussian smoothing algorithm. The output is a smoothed label map.
executable.contributor: Dirk Padfield (GE), Josh Cates (Utah), Ross Whitaker (Utah)
executable.acknowledgements: This work is part of the National Alliance for Medical Image Computing (NAMIC), funded by the National Institutes of Health through the NIH Roadmap for Medical Research, Grant U54 EB005149. This filter is based on work developed at the University of Utah, and implemented at GE Research.

parameters.label: Label Selection Parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for selecting the label to smooth

integer.name: labelToSmooth
integer.description: The label to smooth. All others will be ignored. If no label is selected by the user, the maximum label in the image is chosen by default.
integer.label: Label to smooth

integer.name: numberOfIterations
integer.description: The number of iterations of the level set AntiAliasing algorithm
integer.label: Number of Iterations

float.name: gaussianSigma
float.description: The standard deviation of the Gaussian kernel
float.label: Sigma
